content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSDECOD
      operator: equal_to
      value: INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED
    - name: RFICDTC
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: Min(DS.SSTDTC)
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0068 (DUPLICATE)
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when DSDECOD = "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED" and min(DS.DSSTDTC)
  for a subject ^= to DM.RFICDTC
Outcome:
  Message: Earliest DSSTDTC does not equal DM.RFICDTC, When multiple informed consents
    obtained for a subject.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTMIG and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0068
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: "Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character\
                  \ format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent\
                  \ in the Disposition domain,\n if that protocol milestone is documented."
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Raise an error when DSDECOD = "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED" and min(DS.DSSTDTC) for a subject ^= to DM.RFICDTC

Outcome.Message: Earliest DSSTDTC does not equal DM.RFICDTC, When multiple informed consents obtained for a subject.

Citations.Cited_Guidance:
Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain,
 if that protocol milestone is documented.
